page.title: 03KIRKLEVINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: The original Domesday Book shows Kirk- levington among the crown lands as a "Manor in Lentune". Today it is a busy commuter village.It is popular for housing built in a rural setting within reach of Middlesbrough, Stockton, Darlington & Industrial Teesside. There are{412}houses now compared with 28 in 1947. There are {815}people over 18 years & approx. {220}children living in the village. Fifty years ago every field was named, but now the roads built on them are named thus: Forest Lane, St. Martins Way. The Village Hall, Church, School and "Crown" Pub are meeting places for villagers. Mr. Fairs owns the village shop, but for facilities other than post & telephone, people travel to Yarm & beyond. The United Bus stops at Forest Lane end on the A67 but most people have their own transport.
